ygData.subject: Re: New Sketches
ygData.msgSnippet: In order to advance in the skill, they will need to now invest a good amount of plat to get the skill up. i know the pie tin and large bowl sketches cost over
ygData.messageBody:
In order to advance in the skill, they will need to now invest a good
amount of plat to get the skill up. i know the pie tin and large bowl
sketches cost over a plat each.

On Wed, 28 Jul 1999, Elena Glenn wrote:

> From: "Elena Glenn" <braveheart@...>
>
> I would assume the vials will be used to hold poison. With the new patch,
> Rogues are now able to apply poison to their weapon. So what's to stop all
> the Rogues from now taking up the pottery skill and making their own vials?
> This makes little or no sense to me. I don't see how this 'enhancement'
> will help us potters in any way. Just my two cents worth.
>
> Kirree
> Bard of Xegony
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Dan Alexander <dalex@...>
> To: EQ_Potters@onelist.com <EQ_Potters@onelist.com>
> Date: Wednesday, July 28, 1999 8:44 AM
> Subject: RE: [EQ_Potters] New Sketches
>
>
> >From: Dan Alexander <dalex@...>
> >
> >At 10:37 AM 07/28/1999 -0400, you wrote:
> >>From: "Mitchell Okun" <Mitchell_Okun@...>
> >>
> >>
> >>
> >><<The new (vial) sketches are at the merchant(s) that sells the blocks of
> >clay
> >>and firing sheets. Has anyone else seen any other new sketches out and
> >>about?>>
> >>
> >>The sketch seller in Halas has all three Vial sketches, as well as Ceramic
> >>Lining (don't remember if that was there before, but as a Ranger this
> >interests
> >>me as people are looking for Ceramic Bows and Staves).
> >
> >
> >Does anyone know what these vials are used for? And how they're supposed
> >to help potters play a part in player/player eq economy? "Vials" makes me
> >think of potions, and thus Alchemy. So... they took away our profit and
> >gave us new sketches that are only useful to one race? In the name of
> >player-based economy? Tell me it's not so, and vials do have some other
> >function....please?
> >
> >-Pennaggolan, who remembers when patches actually helped players, rather
> >than hinder them.
> >
